title: Why would rich people write a book to teach us how to be rich? - Quora

response.answer_text: People tend to think wealth is a zero sum game. We often think that, if one person has become wealthy, they must have had to climb over others.  Or they think that one of the results of one person becoming wealthy is that many other people have to languish in want. This is one of the main fallacies of communism and class envy. When one becomes wealthy, they in fact usually bring a lot of others with them. Bill Gates is a multi-billionaire and he created many millionaires in addition to many upper middle class professionals.  This did nothing to diminish his wealth. In fact, putting talented individuals into positions where they could become wealthy, elevated his own wealth further. If Bill writes a book telling others how he made his fortune, this does not put his own fortune in danger. In fact, it is more likely it will elevate his status further.  Now, to be sure, there are pretenders who write books telling people how to get rich, who are only trying to get rich themselves. If someone says "Buy my program on how to become a millionaire by the time you're 40," you're right to be skeptical. They might just be trying to get rich themselves by charging everyone $300 for a multi-media kit on how to get rich. Getting rich is a tempting commodity to sell. But for the most part, helping others toward prosperity does nothing to diminish one's own wealth, and can even elevate that person's wealth and status.
